summary: An ordinance relating to and providing for the improvement of the alley lying 100 feet north of Yesler Way and extending from 1st Avenue to Post Street, in the City of Seattle by paving the same, with vitrified brick, all in accordance with Resolution No. 46 and providing the payment therefor by the mode of 'Payment by Bond' as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
